metadata.title: CVE-2018-14625 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux Kernel where an attacker may be able to havean uncontrolled read to kernel-memory from within a vm guest. A racecondition between connect() and close() function may allow an attackerusing the AF_VSOCK protocol to gather a 4 byte information leak or possiblyintercept or corrupt AF_VSOCK messages destined to other clients.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19

No subscription required
